title: Micro Wave: Why Some Fruits Ripen Faster In A Paper Bag
description:
Pomologist Juan Carlos Melgar explains two key factors to why some fruits ripen faster in a paper bag — and others don't.

Plus, a bit of listener mail from you! Which you can always send by emailing shortwave@npr.org.

itunes:title: Micro Wave: Why Some Fruits Ripen Faster In A Paper Bag
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Two key factors to why some fruits, including peaches, ripen faster in a paper bag — and others don't.
itunes:subtitle: Two key factors to why some fruits, including peaches, ripen faster in a paper bag — and others don't.

Plus, a bit of listener mail from you! Which you can always send by emailing shortwave@npr.org.
